channel.title: Comments on: Friday Go Forward: Week 27

item.title: By: Ben
item.dc:creator: Ben
item.description: To your first point, I would have to say that KGS shodan is most certainly not unlikely for you. Haha. I certainly see it in the cards for you! And to your next point, I think you've hit on the important point: you're happy with the way things are now. Perhaps goals are just overrated and end up causing more frustration than anything else with something like go. I don't think it has anything to do with you being an undriven person. In fact, I think your steady habits that produce consistent results is extremely admirable and something not enough people do. Oftentimes I see players try to put forth extraordinary amount of effort and then drop it all when they don't see results of relative scale and size. In the end though, I know that one thing I will always be able to count on is a great game with you. =)
item.content:encoded:
To your first point, I would have to say that KGS shodan is most certainly not unlikely for you. Haha. I certainly see it in the cards for you!
And to your next point, I think you’ve hit on the important point: you’re happy with the way things are now. Perhaps goals are just overrated and end up causing more frustration than anything else with something like go.
I don’t think it has anything to do with you being an undriven person. In fact, I think your steady habits that produce consistent results is extremely admirable and something not enough people do. Oftentimes I see players try to put forth extraordinary amount of effort and then drop it all when they don’t see results of relative scale and size.
In the end though, I know that one thing I will always be able to count on is a great game with you. =)

item.title: By: Nate Eagle
item.dc:creator: Nate Eagle
item.description: Hmmm, reaching KGS shodan would be nice, but unlikely for me, given my pace over the last two years. Not impossible, I guess: reaching solid one kyu status isn't too much of a reach, and this would be just a stone beyond. But, to be honest, I don't know how much setting a goal for myself would help. I play about as much go as my life will possibly allow, and I'm making progress this way. I'm actually feeling pretty happy with how things are going right now. I know that reveals how undriven a person I am, but I think there's something to be said for settling into habits that steadily produce results vs. trying to summon the will to make extraordinary efforts. I have no doubt that I'm doomed to never be an extraordinary player, but that wasn't REALLY in the cards for someone who started at my age, anyway. I think it meshes pretty well with my goal to enjoy go in a deeper and more profound way throughout my life pretty well.
item.content:encoded:
Hmmm, reaching KGS shodan would be nice, but unlikely for me, given my pace over the last two years. Not impossible, I guess: reaching solid one kyu status isn’t too much of a reach, and this would be just a stone beyond.
But, to be honest, I don’t know how much setting a goal for myself would help. I play about as much go as my life will possibly allow, and I’m making progress this way. I’m actually feeling pretty happy with how things are going right now.
I know that reveals how undriven a person I am, but I think there’s something to be said for settling into habits that steadily produce results vs. trying to summon the will to make extraordinary efforts. I have no doubt that I’m doomed to never be an extraordinary player, but that wasn’t REALLY in the cards for someone who started at my age, anyway. I think it meshes pretty well with my goal to enjoy go in a deeper and more profound way throughout my life pretty well.

item.title: By: Ben
item.dc:creator: Ben
item.description: You bring up an excellent point. I guess to clarify, it's not so much that I'm now confused about whether I'm actually a fighter / power player, but more along the lines of realizing how much farther I have to go to truly hone my skills. I think your example of how a players who are a few stones stronger can often blow away our strongest skills with their weakest is spot on. I definitely have to be careful of letting that mess with my self-perception that for sure. However, at the end of the day, I know that both you and I are aiming to leave behind the kyu world in the near future (in fact, I wouldn't be surprised if both you and I have a similar goal to attend Go Congress as dans =D). So it's been a great reality check as to what I need to do to get there. =)
item.content:encoded:
You bring up an excellent point. I guess to clarify, it’s not so much that I’m now confused about whether I’m actually a fighter / power player, but more along the lines of realizing how much farther I have to go to truly hone my skills.
I think your example of how a players who are a few stones stronger can often blow away our strongest skills with their weakest is spot on. I definitely have to be careful of letting that mess with my self-perception that for sure.
However, at the end of the day, I know that both you and I are aiming to leave behind the kyu world in the near future (in fact, I wouldn’t be surprised if both you and I have a similar goal to attend Go Congress as dans =D). So it’s been a great reality check as to what I need to do to get there. =)

item.title: By: Nate Eagle
item.dc:creator: Nate Eagle
item.description: I dunno how strongly you should take this "I found out I can't attack properly" thing. Attacking skill is on a spectrum, and it involves a number of different parts. Maybe you ARE a fighter / power player, but you found someone whose defense is much stronger than your attack. That's gonna happen - go more than a few stones above me in strength, and most players' weakest skills are going to blow apart my strongest. It might be good to have your confidence checked so that you invest energy in honing your ability, but I would caution you against letting it alter your self-perception too much.
item.content:encoded:
I dunno how strongly you should take this “I found out I can’t attack properly” thing. Attacking skill is on a spectrum, and it involves a number of different parts. Maybe you ARE a fighter / power player, but you found someone whose defense is much stronger than your attack. That’s gonna happen – go more than a few stones above me in strength, and most players’ weakest skills are going to blow apart my strongest.
It might be good to have your confidence checked so that you invest energy in honing your ability, but I would caution you against letting it alter your self-perception too much.
